Job Posting:174193 - Position: W26 Student, Data Developer (8-months) 174193B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 10/19/2025 11:00 PM Through Employer Website 10/07/2025 03:23 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Alberta Investment Management Corporation (AIMCO) 100 King Street West, Suite 5 First Canadian Place Toronto M5X 1B1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION 2026 - Winter W26 Student, Data Developer (8-months) 174193B Co-op Position Calgary or Edmonton, AB Canada 8 months CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description Job Req: JR100699 Opportunity This is a unique opportunity to leverage your data developer skills and contribute to AIMCo's data modernization journey, enabling data-driven decisions through advanced analytics techniques. The Data & AI group is a highly skilled team passionate about the entire data lifecycle and empowering AIMCo to realize its full analytical potential. This learning-focused group is committed to building a modern data platform, cross-training others, and leveraging platform development expertise to elevate the skill profile across the organization. We are seeking someone knowledgeable about the data life cycle to support our teams in enhancing system architecture and building the modern data platform at AIMCo. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines, data models, and data analysis solutions on cloud platforms. Under the guidance of senior developers, data architects, and data scientists, you will ensure data is integrated effectively, efficiently, and securely across the organization. Your passion for data and intellectual curiosity will enable you to assist others, find efficiencies, and explore new and creative ways to use data in various domains. This position is open to candidates who are willing to relocate to Alberta, and we encourage all interested individuals to apply. Responsibilities: • Support team in developing data pipelines to extract, load, and transform data from various sources into cloud-based data warehouses and data lakes. • Learn how to implement data processing workflows that are highly optimized for their cloud-native environment. • Collaborate with senior developers and data architects to design and implement scalable and reliable data architectures on cloud platforms. • Assist with monitoring and maintaining the performance of cloud-based data warehouses and data pipelines, troubleshoot issues, and optimize query performance. • Work with data analysts to understand data requirements and design data models that enable effective reporting and analysis. • Provide support services to internal clients including root-cause analysis, debugging, training, and consultation services. • Increase data awareness and quality by providing internal training. Success Measures As the successful Student in the Data and AI group, you will complete your work term with a sense of pride and accomplishment regarding all the new skills and knowledge you were able to attain. The connections you will build within and outside of the team should be able to rave about all the great work you did to make the jobs of others more streamlined and effective. Final candidates will be asked to undergo a security screening, which includes a credit bureau and a criminal record investigation, the results of which must be acceptable to AIMCo. ALERT - Be on the lookout for AIMCo career opportunities advertised through third parties that request an application fee or too much information. To verify, all opportunities are posted on aimco.ca/jobs At AIMCo, we draw upon the differences in who we are, where we come from and the way we think to deliver results for the Albertans who rely on us. We offer an inclusive, modern workplace where well-being is prioritized, and colleagues are enabled to do their best work. Our team members are motivated by our purpose and committed to creating long-term value for our clients and their beneficiaries. Job Requirements Our Ideal Candidate Qualifications: • Pursuing a bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or related field. • Experience designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines. • Demonstrates a strong commitment to AIMCo's core values of excellence, transparency, humility, integrity, and collaboration, and inspires the same in others. • Experience with Cloud Platform services such as Azure and Azure Data Factory • Demonstrated coding skills in Python, SQL and knowledge of software engineering principles around testing, code reviews, and deployment. • Experience in data modeling and Data transformation technologies such as dbt will be an asset. • Exposure to Business Intelligence visualization software like Microsoft Power BI, TIBCO Spotfire, Tableau, etc. is a desirable asset. • Experience working with DevOps pipelines continuous integration/delivery, and automated testing (unit, functional, performance) • Database architecture, design, implementation, and operations experience is an asset. • Able to present ideas to internal client groups and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. • Prioritization skills, acute attention to detail with demonstrated experience analyzing and implementing data quality solutions. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions ***Job Posting will expire at 11:59pm MT on October 19, 2025 Next Steps We are excited to meet you. Please submit your resume or CV to be considered for this opportunity. Applications are being reviewed on a rolling basis and we will be in touch with any questions. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
